tool.name: StreamPowerIndex

param.name: dem
param.dialogReference:
Digital Elevation Model (DEM) provides elevation data for the program.

Consider hydro-conditioning the model for more accurate hydrology using the `Burn Culverts in DEM` tool

param.name: z_unit
param.dialogReference: Vertical units of DEM. This can be set using Data Management/Define Projection to set a vertical coordinate system

param.name: stream
param.dialogReference:
Stream line feature class - providing this argument will limit the output SPI raster to the stream path

Consider using a hydrologically accurate (to your DEM) stream line created using the `Calculate Stream Network` tool for best results

tool.summary:
This tool calculates a stream power index from a digital elevation model (DEM) by finding slope and flow accumulation in the analysis area.

It uses the following formula: SPI = ln(DA * S), where:

  • SPI = Stream Power Index

  • DA = Drainage Area (# of cells)

  • S = Slope (percent)

This does not provide stream power (Watts) or specific stream power (Watts/m), but rather a dimensionless value the benefit of which is comparative rather than absolute. Stream power is proportional to slope and discharge. Here we use drainage area as a proxy for discharge which is a reasonable assumption. but neglects the reality that each watershed will have a different relationship between drainage area an discharge, often expressed as Q=a*A^b, where b often is a value less than 1. Thus use of the stream power index becomes less accurate as watershed differences (land use, soils, etc) increases.
